job_title: PieperPower Endowed Chair in Artificial Intelligence
job_Description: The Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) department at the Milwaukee School of Engineering (MSOE) seeks applicants for the PieperPower Endowed Chair in Artificial Intelligence. The Chair will act as a catalyst to establish a global collaboration that will address the societal challenges and opportunities brought forth by the widespread use and increasing power of artificial intelligence.  The Chair will be a leader who exemplifies the six values of MSOE: collaboration, excellence, inclusion, innovation, integrity, and stewardship. The Chair’s impact will be global community participation in the advancement of AI-based solutions that solve the complex technical and ethical challenges of today and tomorrow, consistent with MSOE’s mission.  The Chair will hold a full-time faculty position at the Associate Professor or Professor rank and will pursue scholarship advancing the interaction of artificial intelligence with humans and its potential impacts on society. The successful candidate will demonstrate the potential to produce impactful scholarly work in this field, teach courses in Computer Science at the undergraduate and graduate level, serve as a research and capstone project advisor, and contribute to the fulfillment of the University’s strategic plan,  Extraordinary Together .  The Chair will contribute to MSOE’s established strength in the area of artificial intelligence. The EECS department offers five undergraduate degrees including a Computer Science degree with a focus on artificial intelligence as well as a Software Engineering degree. The department also offers a graduate Certificate in Applied Machine Learning and plans to offer a master’s degree program in Machine Learning. Significant investments have been made to support MSOE’s academic mission including the construction of the $34M Dwight and Dian Diercks Computational Science Hall. More information about the programs and building are available at https://www.msoe.edu/diercks-hall/. Faculty enjoy small class sizes and hands-on labs as well as continuous improvement and sustained professional development. Among the department’s strengths are strong partnerships with numerous businesses and academic institutes, which guide applied projects, research, and curriculum development.  Candidates with the potential to produce high-impact applied knowledge in the general area of AI- human interaction are encouraged to apply. Candidates with expertise in the following areas are especially desired: adversarial networks, cybersecurity, socially beneficial data science, dataset/algorithm bias, natural language processing, medical data analysis, ensemble methods and learning, and AI in complex systems. Applicants must have strong oral and written communication skills and an earned doctorate degree. The Chair will be expected to teach courses at the undergraduate and graduate level within the EECS Department, with a reduced teaching load to allow for the building of new collaborations and scholarly research.  MSOE is a leading undergraduate and master’s level private, non-profit educational institution founded in 1903. The institution serves approximately 3,000 students in the areas of engineering, computing, mathematics, business, nursing and user experience.  MSOE is in the heart of downtown Milwaukee, a burgeoning tech hub known for its numerous festivals, beautiful lakefront, and cultural activities. MSOE offers competitive benefits including medical, dental, life, disability and vision insurance, and a retirement plan. Educational benefits are available for employees and family members as well as an on-campus fitness center for all employees  When applying, please upload a  single PDF  file under the “Resume Upload” portion of the application. A complete application includes: 1) a letter of interest 2) a curriculum vita 3) statement of research interests 4) statement of teaching interest areas (including evidence of successful teaching if available) 5) contact information for three professional references.
